info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 25 at 2:09AM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southeastern Boundary and east central Bonner Counties through 145 AM PDT... At 109 AM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 12 miles south of Bonners Ferry, moving northeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of southeastern Boundary and east central Bonner Counties. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
